ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Setting ProxyPort via UI Scripting Console
ygData.msgSnippet: hello Shay, thanks for your question. as you noted (and Gordon pointed out), you can set FetchHttp.httpProxyPort in H3 using the Scripting Console , as well

hello Shay,

thanks for your question. as you noted (and Gordon pointed out),
you can set FetchHttp.httpProxyPort in H3 using the "Scripting
Console", as well as using the "Browse beans" features under the
Advanced heading, e.g.

1) after a successful build, you can use the "Browse beans"
feature by selecting "Browse beans" from the job page, and
navigating to "fetchHttp" (crawlController > fetchProcessors
 > fetchHttp in a default crawl config), and then select
"httpProxyPort" and then "Edit". you can enter the desired
port number in the text box.

2) after a successful build, you can also use the "Scripting
Console" feature to change the port number, e.g. a Bean Shell
script like
this:

   setAccessibility(true);
   rawOut.println(appCtx.getBean("fetchHttp").httpProxyPort.value);
   appCtx.getBean("fetchHttp").httpProxyPort=999;
   rawOut.println(appCtx.getBean("fetchHttp").httpProxyPort.value);

this will print into the web UI the old and new port numbers.
you can verify the new setting using method (1).

hope that helps!

/steve@...


Seamus Lawless wrote:
>  
> 
> Hi all,
> 
> 
> I am having a problem with known bug 1731 
> (https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1731 
> <https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1731>) in Heritrix 3.0.0.
> 
> In the comments, Gordon mentioned that it is possible to set the proxy 
> port value post-build pre-launch via the Scripting Console in the UI.
> 
> Does anybody have any idea how to do this?
> 
> Thanks a mill,
> 
> Shay
